image.altText: The wreck of a vehicle near a road.

props.synopsis: Police say the driver of the car was cut from the wreck and taken to hospital but died a short time later.

title.children: Wanted man dies in head-on truck crash after police pursuit

image.altText: A woman in ski gear, at the snow.

props.synopsis: At a time when many Aussies are heading off for beach holidays, a group of snow sports athletes are chasing winter with their sights set on the next Olympic Games.

title.children: No summer break for Australian athletes chasing Winter Olympic glory

image.altText: Stuffed animals, wilted flowers, picture frames, and heartfelt messages left on the trunk of a tree next to a road.

props.synopsis: Nowra man Lachlan Stuckey is facing three charges of dangerous driving occasioning death over a single-vehicle car crash which killed three of his friends near Tarago in July last year.

title.children: Family of woman killed in Tarago crash say driver has 'shown no remorse'

image.altText: Cartoon of Anthony Albanese sitting alone in the Speaker's chair in the House of Representatives.

props.synopsis: The annual showcase of the year's top political cartoons has opened at Old Parliament House in Canberra, depicting the biggest national and global events with satire and wit.

title.children: 'A lot to poke fun at': The best political cartoons of 2025

image.altText: A blue bus travelling through Canberra's city centre

props.synopsis: The ACT government says the bus network will change from term 1 next year as it flags major disruption from work on Commonwealth Avenue Bridge.

title.children: 'Go out for dinner': Free fares for summer amid Canberra construction chaos

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: A Canberra man is sentenced to 10 years in jail for manslaughter, after the ACT Court of Appeal overturned his murder conviction for the death of his partner.

title.children: Canberra man sentenced to 10 years in jail for manslaughter of partner

image.altText: A phone screen showing social media apps.

props.synopsis: The High Court of Australia agrees to hear a special case brought by two teenagers challenging the federal government's upcoming social media ban for Australians under 16.

title.children: High Court agrees to hear teens' challenge to social media ban

image.altText: A woman, her face obsucred, looks at a framed photograph of women and children in the desert

props.synopsis: In the 1960s, the last of the desert families were coming into contact with white people. For one woman, the moment was captured on camera.

title.children: Rare photo that captures 'first contact' between desert families and white Australia

image.altText: A Latina woman with long brown hair and a guide dog walking across a crowded crossing

props.synopsis: Living with vision impairment throws up many challenges. Being Deaf on top of that requires you to go to even greater lengths just to fit in with the modern world. This is how one Deafblind woman does it.

title.children: Jael is Deaf and blind. Here's how she goes about her day

image.altText: Men in firefighting uniforms spray water on a bunch of smouldering wreckage.

props.synopsis: A large-scale Russian drone and missile attack damages power facilities in eight Ukrainian regions, causing blackouts and forcing nuclear power plants to cut output.

title.children: Nuclear stations taken offline as Russian drones bombard Ukraine

image.altText: Thailand’s Prime Minister Anutin Charnvirakul

props.synopsis: Accused of incompetence and apathy in the aftermath of natural disasters, governments across Asia are facing increasing backlash as the impact of global warming intensifies.

title.children: A new storm is brewing in South-East Asia. This time it's in the halls of power

image.altText: A photo of Adam Watts in police uniform smiling alongside a  photo of a NSW Police logo.

props.synopsis: A former NSW Police officer with post-traumatic stress disorder had his mental health incorrectly challenged by a doctor who never consulted or examined him during a year-long battle with the force's insurer.

title.children: Officer's mental health questioned by insurance doctor he'd never met

image.altText: New prep-aged children sit on floor in circle in prep classroom playing barrel of monkeys game at Spring Mountain State School.

props.synopsis: Parents had the opportunity to pore over NAPLAN results for their children's school this week, but interpreting the data may not have been clear at first glance.

title.children: Why you may want to take a closer look at a school's NAPLAN results

image.altText: A large amount of fire can be seen blasting from the end of a piece of Ukrainian artillery

props.synopsis: Russian President Vladimir Putin this week claimed Moscow's biggest battlefield gain in close to two years: the Ukrainian city of Pokrovsk. Some experts don't believe him.

title.children: Why the small city of Pokrovsk means so much to Vladimir Putin

image.altText: A high shot of beach cabanas set up near the water at Noosa beach

props.synopsis: First responders say they are having to live well outside their operating regions due to lack of available housing.

title.children: First responders struggling to find homes in tourism hotspot

image.altText: Steve Smith, Mitchell Starc and Jofra Archer

props.synopsis: A sleepy Jofra Archer cops a rinsing from Matthew Hayden, as the English finally make it through the first over of an innings. Here are the quick hits from day three of the Gabba Ashes Test.

title.children: Five quick hits: The first 'English' wicket and Archer's 'shocking look'

image.altText: The top three F1 drivers in qualifying stand on the podium, with (left to right) Lando Norris, Max Verstappen and Oscar Piastri.

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri warns he's not out of the Formula One title hunt yet, even if many only now have eyes on a Lando Norris-Max Verstappen duel for the crown.

title.children: 'I've got a chance': Piastri won't rule out F1 boilover despite tough qualifying

image.altText: A man in a dark dry suit floating with his head above water in a pool, in scuba diving gear.

props.synopsis: Open water divers say underwater visibility has improved and marine life is returning to some areas off South Australia's coast. Experts say it's a positive sign, but warn it's "way too early" to say the environment is recovering from the state's algal bloom.

title.children: Fish returning to some parts of SA's coast, divers say

image.altText: Packages of seized cocaine wrapped up and displayed at an AFP press conference.

props.synopsis: The alleged use of an international livestock ship to smuggle drugs into Western Australia last month prompted a media storm, but one expert says it is just one among a "dizzying variety" of methods criminals are trying.

title.children: 'Motherships', corpses and 'comical' failures as drug smugglers try it all

image.altText: a gurney is seen inside a green tiled cell through a barred window

props.synopsis: On this day in history, the US carried out its first execution by lethal injection — a method thought up by one doctor.

title.children: At 32, this doctor was tasked with finding a 'humane' way to kill people

image.altText: A white seagull with orange beak and legs, grey wings and black tail stands on bitumen.

props.synopsis: Pesky seagulls snatching food from unsuspecting members of the public has spurred a Melbourne council to start canine patrols of Federation Square.

title.children: Dog patrols at Federation Square to curb 'terrifying' seagull swooping

image.altText: Red and black flags with the acronym CMFEU flying in the wind.

props.synopsis: This week's public hearings centred on how a long-running bitter turf war escalated to the point a rival union boss sought help from the state's top cop.

title.children: Union 'turf war' dominates second week of Queensland CFMEU inquiry

image.altText: A display monitor on the handlebars of an e-bike

props.synopsis: An e-bike will be top of their Christmas wish list this year, prompting a warning for parents to know the rules.

title.children: Parents urged to learn rules about e-bikes as Christmas approaches

image.altText: A forest with vines and ferns on the ground and paperbark trees

props.synopsis: Bush Heritage Australia says it is still considering how to safely reopen the walk, which prior to closure was being visited by 100,000 people a year.

title.children: Beloved by Instagrammers, walk closed to preserve paperbark forest

image.altText: Jai Opetaia punches

props.synopsis: Jai Opetaia defends his IBF and The Ring cruiserweight world titles against Hüseyin Cinkara with a savage knock out on the Gold Coast.

title.children: 'P***** off' Opetaia wins brutal test by savage eighth-round knock out

image.altText: Australian bowler Michael Neser holds his arms out, with the ball in one hand as England's Ollie Pope stands at the other end.

props.synopsis: Bowling all-rounder Michael Neser is back and taking vital wickets after beginning to think he had played his last Test match for Australia.

title.children: Caught-and-bowled king Neser feared his Test career was over

image.altText: A massive Christmas tree adorned with lights and a star stands in a public square at night, as a crowd takes photos with phones.

props.synopsis: As the ceasefire in Gaza enters its second month, the Palestinian city revered by Christians as the birthplace of Jesus holds a ceremony to light up a 20-metre tree at the edge of Manger Square.

title.children: As Christmas lights return to Bethlehem, Palestinians look for hope

image.altText: young boy playing on phone while laying on the couch

props.synopsis: These school holidays, children under 16 will find themselves with less social media access as a ban comes into place. We asked the experts how parents can best support their kids with the transition.

title.children: Gearing up for the school holidays? Here's how to survive them without social media

image.altText: A patron peruses art in a gallery.

props.synopsis: More than three years after a Tasmanian council green-lit a plan to ease the financial burden of the Queen Victoria Museum and Art Gallery, stakeholders worry momentum has stalled.

title.children: 'Treasured' gallery that costs ratepayers millions faces a problem

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks to reporters outside the White House

props.synopsis: The US president has spent much of his first year back in office changing the historic building he fought to reclaim in a bid to cement his legacy.

title.children: Trump is remaking the White House in his own image before it is too late

image.altText: a bus with pink livery for Tasmanian mobile breastcreening

props.synopsis: Tasmania's health department was aware a 32-year-old breast cancer screening bus was unsafe for years, but continued operating it up until two staff suffered electric shocks.

title.children: Water leaks, electric shocks force 32yo breast cancer unit off road

image.altText: Afghans prepare the body of a man killed during an overnight exchange of fire between Afghan and Pakistani forces

props.synopsis: Each side has blamed the other for triggering the clash in violation of a tenuous two-month ceasefire, with the clashes lasting until dawn Saturday.

title.children: Overnight fire exchange at Afghan-Pakistan border kills five civilians and wounds eight

image.altText: Royals Xmas 2025

props.synopsis: Heir to the throne, Prince William, was due to deliver a reading before 1,600 guests along with actors Kate Winslet, Chiwetel Ejiofor and Joe Locke, as well as actor and comedian Babatunde Aléshé.

title.children: 'Life can sometimes feel fragmented': Princess Kate celebrates community work at Christmas service
